segments.text: I see the water overflowing from the sink, creating a puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's spreading wider and wider, but the woman doesn't seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit frustrated watching the water just pour out like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a waste, and it's going to make a big mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why the drain isn't working, or if it's just clogged.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is streaming down the cabinet doors, ruining the wood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone notices soon, before it gets even worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so focused on the cookies, they don't seem to care about the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think if I were there, I'd turn off the faucet right away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's just a bit infuriating to see it all go to waste like that.
segments.speaker: PAR
